knowledges.title: Knowledges
knowledges.description: List of the things I know and have experience with.

books.title: C++
books.description: Like it a lot. Large control on ressources, you can't do something wrong without knowing it. Can be hard to compile and debug at times.

books.title: Java
books.description: Usefull. Do like the fact that you can have methods and property on enums. A little bit too verbose for me.

books.title: C#
books.description: My go to language. Less heavy than Java, but still multiplatform, clear syntax, easy to use, easy to debug, easy to compile, easy to deploy.

books.title: Python
books.description: Nice if you want something working fast, easy to start / use, a lot of easily accessible libraries. Do like all the small syntax tricks.

books.title: TypeScript
books.description: And Javascript as well. Everything is easy to do, and so is making bad design choices. Promises are a pain.

books.title: HTML/CSS
books.description: It does it's job well, even more then you start to compare it to other markup languages (XAML ?).

books.title: Astro.js
books.description: Make it possible to use multiple techs in one project. Totally onboard with making the site as light as possible and separating what is static and dymanic.

books.title: Webpack
books.description: Nice to cleany bundle and nicely separate everything. Should be used on every medium and big project.

books.title: Vite
books.description: Simpler and faster than webpack. I really like it :)

books.title: Vuejs
books.description: A good balance between complexity and simplicity. Fast, light and with all the options you will need for a medium or large app.

books.title: Angular
books.description: Well structured but more complexe than Vuejs, still does the job pretty well.

books.title: SvelteKit
books.description: Very intersting, fast, good and efficient syntax, one straighforward way to do things. Rarelly been this satisfaised by a framework.

books.title: MySQL
books.description: Nothing special to say about it (which is kinda a compliment).

books.title: SQL Server
books.description: Work as fine as MySQL but with the Microsoft touch.

books.title: MongoDB
books.description: Should be used more often for large dataset that are not requiring relationships.

books.title: Keras
books.description: Have a lot of models, pretty easy to use, would recommand.

books.title: Tensorflow
books.description: Good well documented way to start doing some neural network and more generally machine learning.

books.title: Docker
books.description: Nice to create complete development environments. Make it easy to deploy, restore and load balance servers.

books.title: Maui
books.description: Way less support than Flutter (Microsoft didn't create any official application with it). A lot of different problems that still need to be isued. In theory it's the future of app development.

books.title: WPF
books.description: Nice way to separate the UI from the logic. The XAML syntax is a little bit heavy for me.

books.title: JavaFX
books.description: If you need to create a multiplatform app without too much work, it's a good choice. Cleary replace Swing for me.

books.title: SDL2
books.description: The standard C++ graphic library. Nice to use alongside OpenGL, some discutable design choices then you dive really deep.

books.title: SFML
books.description: Way easier to use than SDL2, with the same functionnalities. Great way to start with game development.

books.title: Electron
books.description: The only mature solution if you a multiplatform desktop app with web technologies. It tend to take a lot of space and ressources.

books.title: .NET ASP (Framework / Core)
books.description: Sometime a little bit too magical for me (I like clearly defining the routes, with HTTP verb, route and params). The change from Framework to Core was a pain. Otherwise work really fine.

books.title: Laravel
books.description: The right balance between easy to use and powerfull. The documentation is great, base project architecture taught me a lot.

books.title: Nginx
books.description: Nice and fast, never encountered a situation where I was limited by it during development.

books.title: Apache
books.description: Work as well as nginx but the configuration can be a pain for complexe setups.

books.title: Node.js
books.description: Large ecosystem with a lot of nice frameworks. Make fullstack development easier.

books.title: Express.js
books.description: Nice framework to create an API on Node.js, have a lot of nice plugins.

books.title: Fastify.js
books.description: Greate alternative to Express.js, faster and easy to use.

books.title: Lumen
books.description: Realy nice to make APIs with PHP, not made to host a website.

books.title: Slim
books.description: Nice to create small APIs or websites with PHP without the overhead of big frameworks.

books.title: Swagger
books.description: Fast to setup and easy to use. Should be used on every API for documentation.

experimentations.title: Experimentations
experimentations.description: List of the things I experimented with, but didn't made a full project with.

contents.title: rust
contents.description: Different paradigm from what I am familiar with. Peculiar syntax, need some time to be used to.

contents.title: Kotlin
contents.description: I do like what they did with the language, take some time to accostum to it but I see how it can save a lot of time (even more compared to Java).

contents.title: Swift
contents.description: Nice language, a lot of nice features, I like a lot the storyboard concept. The only downside is that it's only for Apple.

contents.title: Tauri
contents.description: Nice alternative to Electron, but still in early development (documentation is lacking and some options are missing).

contents.title: Flutter
contents.description: Interesting concept, complete API / functionnalites and a lot of plugins. Not realy fan of the fact that it's really easy to mix logic and UI.

contents.title: Avalonia UI
contents.description: Seems to be what MAUI should be.

contents.title: Cordova
contents.description: It's a pain to use, but it's the only way to create a multiplatform (including mobile) app with web technologies.

contents.title: Ionic
contents.description: Corodva without the pain of Cordova. A lot of nice prebuilt components.

contents.title: React
contents.description: I don't understand why it's used that much. There is 5 different way to do aynthing and as much way to do it wrong. The syntax is heavy (God forbid JSX and states).

contents.title: Nuxt
contents.description: Tried it just after v3 have been released so there was not much documentation. Otherwise like everything about it (it's realy worth the assle) !

books.title: Books
books.description: I like to read here and there, mostly fantasy and sci-fi.

outdoor.title: Going outdoor
outdoor.description: I like to do some trekking, with a bike or on foot. Lastly I have tried some electric motocross, wich is the most fun vehicle I ever used :)

network.title: Network
network.description: Aside from programming I also studied networtking and security, from deployment to supervision.
